channel.title: Would this be considered as a correct answer? Java question
channel.description:
In the following Java statement, what does the [b]placeholder[/b] do? System.out.printf("*%-4d*\n*====*", width*height); Tick exactly three answers
Here were the options:
Display a String value Display the value aligned to the left Display an integer value Displays the value aligned to the right Display a decimal point value Displays the value aligned with a minimum of 4 columns Displays the value aligned with a maximum of 4 columns
Now considering all of the answers say "display" and no other information was given, I assumed this was printed to the console and it's asking what does the answer give. They did not accept the answer "Display a String value". Now doesn't the System.out or PrintStream convert everything to a String when it's displaying output, regardless of whether it's first an integer or not? So if this was called, the output, as well as the placeholder would be converted to a String. So when the output is displayed, the placeholder would "Display a String value" Baring in mind this an introductory course and a university level question, and they marked me down for this answer giving me 0/3, as all answers must be correct to obtain the 3 marks. Am I right to argue it? I would totally understand if they re-worded all of the answers to "holds" but "display" implies that it's going to be displayed in the console window right? I'm not too fussed, if I got it wrong I got it wrong but it's just one of those things I thought I'd clarify with people who know their stuff.

item.title: Would this be considered as a correct answer? Java question
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:3, topic:548377”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=667283.msg4462414#msg4462414 date=1418226543]
The placeholder doesn’t display a string value, read the question.
[/quote]

Yeah I see but even after it’s printed out, isn’t the whole output a String, including the placeholder[/quote]
Yes, Java converts it to a string yes. This is what the question was looking for: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Printf_format_string#Type
%-4d is a decimal placeholder and takes a decimal number (weigth*height). %s is a string placeholder and would have to be included for “Display a String value” to be correct. If something is confusing in a question you should ask for clarification.

Read full topic
item.source: Would this be considered as a correct answer? Java question

I would totally understand if they re-worded all of the answers to “holds” but “display” implies that it’s going to be displayed in the console window right?

I’m not too fussed, if I got it wrong I got it wrong but it’s just one of those things I thought I’d clarify with people who know their stuff.
